snippet: Human rights groups said some judges were reluctant to apply the law and found ways around it, or were oblivious to its amendments.
abstract: Morocco Journal; women in Morocco say gender equality remains far off in their country, despite policy measures aimed at guaranteeing parity; some point to Islam-influenced inheritance law section of family code stating that male relatives receive double the inheritance of women; some supporters of women's rights assert that change is inevitable.
lead_paragraph: Human rights groups said some judges were reluctant to apply the law and found ways around it, or were oblivious to its amendments.

headline.main: Gender Inequality in Morocco Continues, Despite Amendments to Family Law
headline.print_headline: Gender Inequality in Morocco Continues, Despite Amendments to Family Law

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
